_header: Of gifts large in love hath great delight
_description: Of the Four Complexions (beginning with Sanguineus) — four stanzas rhyme royal

BodAsh59.First Lines:
Off gifftes large to love haþe gret deliteIoyous and gladde
                    aye of laughing chereOf ruddy colour medele some dele with
                    whiteDisposde by kynde for to be chauntour…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Coward of kynde whane he shoulde be a manþowe shalt him
                    knowe by visage pale and wane
BodAsh59.Note:
Each stanza followed by Latin hexameter couplet (‘Largus
                        amans…’, Thorndike  and  Kibre (1963)
XLynn Thorndike,   and  Pearl Kibre.  
             A Catalogue of Incipits of Mediaeval Scientific Writings in
                Latin.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1963, col. 811); omits
                    stanza on Fleumaticus.
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here nexst foloweþe þe foure complexcyons of man kynde with
                    þe doomis of hem made by discrete Clerkes (f. 71v)

BodDig88.First Lines:
In gyftys large & in love hath grete delyteIocand & gladde
                    ever of laghyng Chere…
BodDig88.Last Lines:
…Coward of kynde when he shuld be a manþou shalt hym
                    knowe by hys vysage pale & wanne
BodDig88.Note: Names of four complexions precede each stanza.

CULFf16.First Lines:
Off yefftis large in loue hayth gret deliteIocund and glad a ay of
                    laughing chereOff Rody collre colour meynd somdell with
                    RedeDysposed to be kynde to be a chauntre…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…Coward of lynd whan he schold be manThou shalt hym knowe by
                    visage pale & wane
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

CamTCC599.First Lines:
Of yiftis large in love hathe gret deliteIocund and glad ay of
                    lawyng chereOf Ruddy coloure meynt somdele with whightDisposid be kynd
                    to be a chauntere…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Coward of kynd when he shuld be a manThou shalt hym knowe bi
                    visage pale & wan
CamTCC599.Note:
Each stanza preceded by Latin verses from which these are translated
                        (‘Natura pingues…’, Thorndike  and  Kibre (1963)
XLynn Thorndike,   and  Pearl Kibre.  
             A Catalogue of Incipits of Mediaeval Scientific Writings in
                Latin.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1963,
                    col. 902) and the Latin hexameter couplets (‘Largus
                    amans…’, Thorndike  and  Kibre (1963)
XLynn Thorndike,   and  Pearl Kibre.  
             A Catalogue of Incipits of Mediaeval Scientific Writings in
                Latin.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1963, col. 811), both from
                        Regimen sanitatis Salernitanum.
CamTCC599.Facsimiles:
Fletcher,  Bradford Y. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Trinity R.3.19. A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, 1987. 

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.19.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.19.
CamTCC599.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 50-2.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Off yiftes large in love hath grete deliteIocunde and gladde ay of
                    laughyng chiere…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Coward of kynde whan he shuld be a manThow shalt hym knowe by
                    visage pale and wan

Headings for ‘Sanguineus’, etc. before each
                    stanza.
